subject: RE: [junit] method dependency
msgSnippet: Maybe this is what you are doing now... sorry if I ve misunderstood.  Is there any reason we can think of that this is such a bad idea? testA(){ obj.a();
messageBody:
Maybe this is what you are doing now... sorry if I've misunderstood. Is
there any reason we can think of that this is such a bad idea?


testA(){
obj.a();
assertions;
}
testB(){
obj.a();
obj.b();
assertions;
}
testC(){
obj.a();
obj.b();
obj.c();
assertions;
}

This is like setting up a test case within a test case.

-Jason

> In my class, I have methods A(),B(), C(), where A() must
> be called before B(), B() before C(). I have individual
> test cases for each method. In order to run the tests in
> the specified order, I must arrange the actual methods in
> the appropriate order. I know this is not a good thing,
> so how do I avoid it? I really hate to lump them into one
> testcase.
>
> Thanks,
>
>
> Scott
> :-> Change is inevitable except from vending machines.
